name: Vice Presidents Quiz | U.S. Government | 10 Questions

questions.text: Andrew Johnson became President upon the assassination of Lincoln, but Johnson wasn't Lincoln's first-term Vice-President. Who was?
questions.explanation:
Hannibal Hamlin.

	The others were also Vice-Presidents - no kidding!

questions.text: Which prominent figure of the pre-Civil War era served as Vice- President?
questions.explanation:
John C. Calhoun

	Under Jackson and Quincy Adams. He left office while he was Jackson's V.P.

questions.text: Who became President upon Garfield's assassination?
questions.explanation:
Chester A. Arthur

	A Forgotten man, but he was very interested in Civil Rights.

questions.text: Which individual served as Vice-President for both James Madison and Thomas Jefferson?
questions.explanation:
George Clinton.

	Clinton, who was this man?

questions.text: Under what President did Daniel Tompkins serve as Vice-President?
questions.explanation:
James Monroe.

	James Monroe was the fifth US president, in which role he served between 1817 and 1825.

questions.text: Which of the following served as Vice-President to James Madison?
Which of the following was Andrew Jackson's Vice-President?
questions.explanation:
Martin Van Buren.

	He then went on to become President.

questions.text: Who served as Vice-President for John Adams?
questions.explanation:
Thomas Jefferson.

	Then Jefferson himself went on to bigger and better things.

questions.text: Which man served as Vice-President to William McKinley?
questions.explanation:
Theodore Roosevelt.

	McKinley's assassination led Roosevelt to the Presidency.

Richard Nixon.

	The rest is History ...
